byline.original: By JO BECKER and RAVI SOMAIYA

abstract: Court papers released in connection with one of dozens of lawsuits that have emerged from the phone hacking scandal that has shaken Rupert Murdoch's media empire reveal that a private detective working for the News of the World cited information from a highly classified intelligence file kept on London nightclub owner Guy Pelly, a close friend of the royal family.
snippet: A lawsuit claims that Glenn Mulcaire, a private detective for the British tabloid The News of the World, has notes that mention a secret government file of a royal family friend.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit claims that Glenn Mulcaire, a private detective for the British tabloid The News of the World, has notes that mention a secret government file of a royal family friend.

headline.main: MI5 References Emerge in Phone Hacking Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: MI5 References Emerge In Phone Hacking Lawsuit
headline.seo: MI5 References Surface in Britain Phone Hacking Suit
